content.title: Subintimal Angioplasty
content.definition: An endovascular technique for crossing chronic total occlusions by intentionally dissecting into the subintimal plane, tracking through the dissection plane, and re-entering the true lumen distally.

clinical_features.entry: Create subintimal plane with looped wire at proximal cap
clinical_features.reentry: Re-enter true lumen distal to occlusion

clinical_features.iliac: Can be used in iliac but more risky

clinical_features.patency: Primary patency 50-60% at 1 year in SFA
clinical_features.role: Bridge to healing in CLI, alternative to bypass

clinical_features.current_role: Part of endovascular toolbox for CTOs
